message.content:
cs.AR, cs.DB, cs.OS, cs.DC, cs.SY. 

This paper discusses the design and implementation of a transactional mechanism for accessing and manipulating data on non-volatile main memory, which is a topic related to computer architecture (cs.AR), database systems (cs.DB), operating systems (cs.OS), distributed computing (cs.DC), and system performance (cs.SY). The paper specifically focuses on reducing the overhead of cache-line flushing for logging-based transactions, which is a performance optimization technique that is relevant to all of these sub-categories. Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.AR, cs.DB, and cs.OS, followed by cs.DC and cs.SY.
